title: Settings dialog doesn't read from .env file
description:
## Problem
The settings dialog does not display values from the .env file. Users expect their environment variable configurations to be reflected in the UI.

## Root Cause Analysis
Config loading priority in `backend/app/config.py:90-160`:
1. Environment variables (highest)
2. config.yaml values
3. Pydantic defaults (lowest)

However, the `GET /api/config` endpoint in `backend/app/main.py:113-131` returns the merged settings, but the UI doesn't distinguish between env-provided values vs config.yaml values.

Issues:
- If config.yaml exists with values, they may override env vars
- No indication to user which values came from where
- PUT /api/config may overwrite env-var-intended settings

## Files to Investigate
- `backend/app/config.py` - Settings loading logic
- `backend/app/main.py:113-131` - GET /api/config endpoint
- `frontend/src/components/SettingsDialog.jsx` - Settings UI

## Solution Ideas
1. Add source tracking to config response (show which values came from env)
2. Disable editing of env-sourced values in UI (read-only indicator)
3. Ensure env vars always take precedence over config.yaml
4. Show env var values with a badge/label in settings dialog
close_reason: Implemented env var source tracking in backend, API returns _env_sources, PUT skips env values, UI shows ENV badge and disables env-sourced fields

title: Setup dialog shows incorrectly on container updates
description:
## Problem
The initial setup dialog often appears when updating to a newer container version, even when the app was already configured.

## Root Cause Analysis
The first-run detection in `backend/app/api/setup.py:64-108` checks:
1. If `/config/config.yaml` exists
2. If TeddyCloud URL is default AND connection test fails

Potential causes:
- Race condition: TeddyCloud not yet available when container starts
- Config file path mismatch between versions
- Connection test timing out during startup

## Files to Investigate
- `backend/app/api/setup.py` - `check_setup_status()` function (lines 64-108)
- `frontend/src/App.jsx` - `checkSetupStatus()` effect (lines 9-26)

## Solution Ideas
1. Add a persistent marker file that indicates setup was completed (not just config.yaml)
2. Implement retry logic for TeddyCloud connection check
3. Add a `setup_completed` flag in config.yaml
4. Consider a grace period before showing setup dialog on startup
close_reason: Fixed by adding setup_completed flag to config.yaml

title: Add pagination support to backend API endpoints
description:
## Problem
All list endpoints return complete datasets without pagination:
- GET /taf-library/ - returns ALL TAF files
- GET /tonies/ - returns ALL tonies  
- GET /rfid-tags/ - returns ALL tags

This causes performance issues with large libraries (100+ items).

## Changes Needed

### Add pagination parameters to endpoints:
- skip: int (offset, default 0)
- limit: int (page size, default 50)
- filter: str (optional, for server-side filtering)

### Create paginated response models:
PaginatedResponse with: items, total_count, page, page_size, has_next

## Files to Modify
- backend/app/models/schemas.py - Add pagination response models
- backend/app/api/taf_library.py - Add skip/limit params
- backend/app/api/tonies.py - Add skip/limit params
- backend/app/api/rfid_tags.py - Add skip/limit params

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All list endpoints accept skip and limit params
- [ ] Response includes pagination metadata
- [ ] Default behavior returns first 50 items
- [ ] Total count still returned for UI pagination controls
close_reason: Implemented pagination support for all three backend list endpoints
